When a solar company sold me panels for my house

He even chooses to buy the certificates from a power plant in Poland to help increase the demand for clean energy in grey or dark grids, where there aren‚Äôt many Renewable Energy facilities yet.

unused, collecting dust. a very expensive paper weight.

When EDGE went live..boom! üí•

Different utilities in Australia actually started to pay me to use my battery at different times of the day

and I'm helping to decarbonize the grid because my battery is being used to balance the grid‚Äînot a fossil-fuel powered plant...

Behind the curtain.. David works for the DNSP (Distribution Network System Operator) and is really happy about EDGE:

Now that these batteries have Digital identities anchored on the Energy Web Chain, we know that we have a battery and where, and we can use it to store or discharge energy to the grid as needed

Before we were blind, and now we see üëÅ

thanks to the traceability and transparency of the Energy Web stack.

For Mark at AEMO (Australia‚Äôs Energy Market Operator) and any other grid operator, it‚Äôs the same thing:

we have a ‚Äúdigital twin‚Äù for that battery, implemented with the EW Stack, all of us market participants finally have a shared view of the assets like the battery, and what is actually happening in the market.

It simplifies our lives üëÅ

tracing and accounting, everything is now common and shared knowledge rather than, error prone and disconnected databases

For the Energy Web community of developers, the EDGE marketplace means that there will be

Thousands of DIDs created on the EWC.üíØ

After EDGE‚Äùs trial period, the architecture has the potential to set a standard for the entire Australian market

In this way, every time the market needs to store electricity in the battery or discharge it to the grid, the system will communicate with each of these DIDs via messaging services provided by the utility layer of the Energy Web Stack

For the whole world, thanks to the law of small numbers, all these batteries, and other similar Distributed energy Resources (DER) help to decarbonize the grid,

reducing the energy required from centralized power plants, üè≠

that especially in Australia are for the 79% still burning fossil fuels.

The EDGE example could be easily deployed across the globe, scaling the positive impact on the environment.
